oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Insignia; Emblems; Seals (insignia); Uniforms; Clothing & dress
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Circular yellow felt patch embroidered in green thread with a tree-filled landscape and the letters "CCC" centrally located on the patch.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Civilian Conservation Corps (C. C. C.) in Tennessee, 1933-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In 1939 this circular patch with the landscape design became the official insignia for the Civilian Conservation Corps. It was to be worn on the left shoulder and also on the Army-issue wool cap that paired with the Civilian Conservation Corps dress uniform.
